recipe_ingredients: half cup of choppped white onion, 2 tablespoons of lime juice, 1 jalepeno, 2 avacados, salt and black pepper
recipe_instructions: STEP 1: combine opnion and lime juice in a small bowl STEP 2: Cut up jalepeno remove the inner seeds chop the jalepeno and add to bowl STEP 3: cut the avacados in half de pit them and scoop out the rest with a spoon, add to bowl then Mix STEP 5: Enjoy!

recipe_ingredients: 1 3/4 pounds of flank steak STEP 2: 6 6 telera rolls, split STEP 3: 1 1/2 cups refried black beans 2 ripe avocados
recipe_instructions: STEP 1 Lay steak on cutting board. Make three diagonal slashes in meat STEP2  Place steak on grill; cook 15 minutes, turning over after 8 minutes. Let rest 10 minutes before thinly slicing against the grain. STEP 3 Spread rolls with a layer of refried beans on one side of each roll and place a layer of sliced avocado on the other side  Divide sliced steak and suggested fillings evenly among rolls

recipe_ingredients: 1 and a half pounds of skirt steak sliced into small pieces, half teaspoon of salt, quarter teaspoon of pepper, 1 tablespoon of oil, half cup of heavy cream, 4 flour tortillas, 1 cup of shredded mexican style cheese blend 1 cup black beans rinsed and drained crema mexicana and chopped tomatoes and cilantro
recipe_instructions: STEP 1: Season steak with salt and pepper. STEP 2: in a large skillet over medium-high heat, heat oil. Add steak and sauté 3 to 5 minutes STEP3: In a small saucepan over medium heat combine guacamole salsa and heavy cream. STEP 4: simmer and keep warm STEP 5 plate and eat!

recipe_ingredients: 1 Organic White Pizza Dough, Pure Olive Oil, All Purpose Flour, Basting Oil, Pizza Sauce,  Shredded Whole Milk Mozzarella, Italian Classics Fresh Mozzarella, sliced Roasted Red Tomatoes, drained Basil leaves torn into smaller pieces
recipe_instructions: Divide dough into 2 equal pieces; form into balls. Coat 2 large bowls with 1/4 tsp olive oil; place 1 dough ball in each. Cover bowls with plastic wrap. Let dough come to room temp, 1-2 hours. 2. Preheat oven to 400 degrees with rack in center. Shape each dough ball on lightly floured surface into 14-inch rounds. Lightly coat two 14-inch pizza pans with 1/4 tsp olive oil. Form dough to fit pans, pressing out any air bubbles. 3. Brush each crust evenly with 1/2 Tbsp basting oil; spread with 1/3 cup of sauce and top with 1/3 cup shredded mozzarella. Break fresh mozzarella into smaller pieces; sprinkle evenly on crusts. Top each crust with 1/2 cup tomatoes. 4. Bake, 18-20 min. Remove from oven; let rest 5 min before slicing. Sprinkle with basil before serving.

recipe_ingredients: 3 pkgs Part-Skim Ricotta Cheese 2. 1 1/2 Tbsp Organic Dried Basil 3. 1 tsp salt Italian Classics Lasagna Sheets , uncooked 4. 3 containers Italian Classics Marinara Sauce, divided 5. 1 pkg Shredded Part-Skim Mozzarella, divided 6. Organic Olive Oil Cooking Spray
recipe_instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Combine ricotta, basil and salt in large bowl; set aside. 2. Spray 9x13-inch pan with cooking spray; spread 1 cup sauce on pan bottom. Top with 2 lasagna sheets, slightly overlapping lengthwise. Spread with half of ricotta mixture. Top with about 1 cup mozzarella cheese. Top with 1 cup sauce. 3. Arrange 2 additional lasagna sheets over sauce. Spread with remaining ricotta mixture; top with about 1 cup mozzarella cheese. Spread with 1 cup sauce. Top with 2 remaining lasagna sheets. Top with 1 cup sauce (serve remaining sauce with finished dish). Place parchment paper directly on sauce to cover; seal with foil. Set baking dish in center of baking sheet. 4. Bake 1 hour, 15 min. Remove from oven; remove foil and paper. Top with about 2 cups mozzarella cheese. Return to oven, uncovered, about 10 min, until cheese melts. Remove from oven; let rest 20-30 min before serving.

recipe_name: Shrimp with vodka blush sauce & veggies
recipe_ingredients: 1. 2 pkgs Certified Organic Large Raw Peeled & Deveined Shrimp, thawed per pkg directions  2. 1 tsp Lawry's Seasoned Salt 3. 2 Tbsp Organic Extra Virgin Olive Oil, divided 4. 2 Red Bell Pepper, cored, seeded, 1/2-inch dice (about 2 1/2 cups) 5. 2 tsp red pepper flakes 6. 1 organic zucchini, 1/2-inch dice (about 2 cups) 7.1 tsp salt 8.1/2 tsp black pepper 9.1 pkg Campari Cocktail Tomatoes, cored, quartered 10. 1 container  Italian Classics Vodka Blush Sauce 11. Organic Italian Parsley leaves, for garnish
recipe_instructions: 1. Add shrimp and seasoned salt to bowl; mix well to coat. Set aside. 2. Heat 1 Tbsp oil in large sauté pan on MED-HIGH until oil faintly smokes. Add red peppers and red pepper flakes; cook, stirring, 1 1/2 min. Add zucchini, salt, and pepper; cook, stirring, 2 min. Add tomatoes; cook, stirring, 3 min. Remove from pan; set aside. 3. Heat remaining oil in pan on MED until oil faintly smokes. Add shrimp; cook, stirring, 2 min. Return vegetables to pan. Add sauce; cook, stirring, 4-5 min until internal temp of shrimp reaches 130 degrees (check by inserting thermometer halfway into thickest part of shrimp). 4. Transfer to serving platter; garnish with parsley.

recipe_ingredients: box of craft mac and cheese
